intro: Streptocalyx orthopoda, commonly known as the rock fig, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, simple leaves, and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that is typically green when mature. Streptocalyx orthopoda is often found growing on rocky outcrops and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
